alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 6:32AM EDT until July 16 at 8:15AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN HUNTERDON, SOUTHWESTERN WARREN, SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH, SOUTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON, AND NORTHWESTERN BUCKS COUNTIES... At 632 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain had moved out of the warned area, but additional light rain is possible over the next hour. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Easton, Bethlehem, Quakertown, Hellertown, Alpha, Bloomsbury, Riegelsville, Glendon, Pleasant Valley, Springtown, Phillipsburg, and Coopersburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 63 and 74. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 8. Northeast Extension between mile markers 44 and 49. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
